headline: Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: These chocolate chip muffins are moist, tender, and deliciously chocolaty. You won't believe how easily and quickly you can have them on the table!

video.description: Watch how to make chocolaty muffins kids love.
video.name: Chocolate Chip Muffins

name: Chocolate Chip Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.

Combine milk, oil, and egg in a small bowl until well blended. Combine flour, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl, making a well in the center. Pour milk mixture into well and stir until batter is just combined; fold in chocolate chips.
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full. Mix 3 tablespoons white sugar and brown sugar together in a small bowl; sprinkle on tops of muffins.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in the tin briefly, then transfer to a wire rack. Serve warm or cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Have made this several times thus far and they are always a hit with the kids. Even the picky eater likes them and asks for more. He's not just a typical picky eater, he has food issues (texture, look, etc.) that turn him off of several foods. For the 2 cups of all-purpose flour, I use 1 cup of regular flour and 1 cup of whole wheat flour. I substitute the oil with unsweetened apple sauce to make it a bit healthier along with adding 1/4 cup of ground flax seed. As suggested, I have added 2 teaspoons of vanilla to give it more flavor. The kids do not realize that they are eating something healthier than the store-bought muffins they've had in the past. This recipe is a win!

It was a bit thick but it turned out okay. Followed the ingredient list to a key and it turned out good. As for taste. It’s crunchy on the outside and flakey on the inside. Doesn’t really feel like a muffin though. Kinda like a mix between a muffin and a cupcake. I didn’t have chocolate chips so I used white chocolate chips instead. Im sure they would be better with chocolate chips. Most of the flavor comes from the chips. Would make again.
quite dry. the batter was thick even though i added enough of the wet ingredients :(
It was the perfect recipe for chocolate chip muffins!!Loved it!!

This recipe is not good. It’s missing a number of things, has too much of other things (brown sugar?) and is the thickest batter I’ve ever made. Had to adjust multiple times and the muffins did not cook through after even 30 minutes. Just not good.

After mixing the recipe as stated, I became concerned about the thickness, especially as it became so dense, pouring it became an issue. Added 2 tablespoons melted butter, vanilla, and a touch more lactose free 2% milk. Only had dark chocolate chips so used that.
More like a tea biscuit texture than a moist fluffy muffin.
I stuck to the recipe and took them out a few mins early. The muffins are bland & dry.
This recipe is good if you like lots of crust and crunch on your muffins.

The instructions were a little weird like the whole mixing white and brown sugar as like layer ontop of the batter I instead added that brown sugar inside and skipped the sugar layer all together ( added a sprinkle of salt instead).For my wet mixture I added some vanilla to it I'm honestly surprised it wasn't in there. Overall wasn't a bad recipe!
Batter did not come out quite right, seemed more like a dough.
I’m glad to know after reading reviews that i wasn’t the only one with weird thick sticky batter! The muffins are bland and a little dry, fine if making for little kids.
It was my first time making a thing from scratch and I think they turned out good. They are still in the oven.

Dryer than a desert. The batter was really weird too, it was like dough, you can make it into a ball and it would keep its shape. I also highly suggest baking it for less time because when I took it out of the oven it was hard.
Great results, I loved it!!!
I think these recipes were great about it. I didn't make any changes or prices.

The recipe is simple to follow. I saw how thick it was and added more milk, vanilla, and a dash of cinnamon. I read reviews after putting them in the oven and saw they did not need the full duration in the oven. They came out very delicious but I added extras to the recipe.
I only put them in for 15 minutes at 400, probably could've used less time or lower heat. I recommend watching them closely.
I made these and the batter was thick needed more milk or oil. The taste was okay since my family doesn't like it too sweet.

Just made these wonderful muffins and it's perfectly delicious! I substituted sugar with coconut sugar and used combination oil consisting of avocado, mct and chia oil came out super soft and not to sweet! topping is a sprinkle of coconut sugar enjoy!! and Thank you for recipe!
Texture is more like a popeyes biscuit. Good thing I added 1 tbsp of butter and a touch more milk.
Didn't enjoy these at all. No taste, very dry. I will not make these again.
It was easy to make. It tasted ok could us something maybe maple syrup. I am allergic to vanilla that is why I use Maple syrup.

I think it is worth it such few ingredients and still pretty good I cooked mine for 15 minuets and also took the advice of putting one cup of milk instead… I think next time I will only cook for ten and then check on them but 20 -25 like recommended is way to much !

I made these muffins today, I followed the recipe- but I found the batter extremely thick and hard to pour into the muffin cups. I baked them anyway- the taste is not bad, but I found them to be quite dry, not moist at all. Don't think I would use this recipe again.
Made X 3 = 42 muffins. Added 1 tsp vanilla. Served with butter, skipped topping. Kids ate half , the other half went into the freezer for breakfast Sunday before church.
Not good. Zero flavor.
quick and easy

This recipe is actually really good and if you follow it then come out moist. I just didn’t add all the extra sugar on top, I added some though, just not as much as they stated and I didn’t measure it just chose to put by sight since there was already so much sugar in the actual mix. Other than that I followed all other instructions and they were amazing.
Kids absolutely loved them!

I followed the recipe exactly as written except I used slightly less sugar to sprinkle on top at the end, which is merely a preference. I baked for 20 mins and they turned out perfectly. The key is to not over-stir the batter. Mine rose beautifully. The only thing I would do differently is maybe spray my baking cups with a little cooking spray. Some of the muffins got a little stuck to the paper but otherwise they were perfect. Easy and delicious!
Dry and lacking flavor.
Nice, I added some vanilla extract to mine aswell
The muffins were dry and I even took other’s advice and added more milk and vanilla, but they just weren’t that good. Wouldn’t make again.
i made these muffins and they were really dry and did not tase good they need to add more milk and vegetable oil to the recipe over all i will not be trying this recipe again
Loved recipe super simple and easy to make
They were really good! Although next time i will be adding more sugar.
These muffins are very dry and do not taste good. I would not reccomend.

Just made these and as experienced baker I never had those nice domes b4. Read you need high temp and boy that is the trick! So thanks for that. I'm sorry but I added applesauce. Instead of more oil or more milk. I usually add sour cream which makes a fabulous moist crumb but was out. I added vanilla too bc you must in my book. Very nice quick recipe for anyone who needs to feed hungry folks. I'm sorry I added to it but wonderful base!

This recipe was pretty good. I ended up using bigger chocolate chips (Slightly Larger than "Normal" sized chocolate chips.") A small handful worked well. I poured in some vanilla extract for flavor. They came out wonderfully and were the perfect breakfast with a hot glass of tea
It was great!! I used Gluten-free flour and substituted 2 bananas and a small Activia mango yogurt for the milk, added some pecans, was delicious!!
Taste was okay. Muffins didn't rise. Probably an inch thick. Followed the recipe exactly.

I should have read the reviews before making these. The batter turned out really thick so I added a little water, but apparently not enough. I baked them for the minimum 20 minutes and they were already overcooked. I would not serve these to a guest.
Had to add more milk. Also, didn’t add topping. But still good
I followed this recipe exactly, baked for 20 minutes and they came out hard and overdone. I should have added more milk to it, I think, because they were very dry unfortunately.
I absolutely loved this sherry wonderful muffins made my kitchen smell great live laugh love is what I say and these are full of that thanks again for the recipe doll 😍😍😍🥰🥰🥰🍷🍷🍷🍷
These were good but I baked them for 25 minutes and they were pretty dry. 20 minutes probably would have been fine.

The recipe easy to follow. The taste could have been a little better. We doubled the ingredients to yield 24 muffins but still only ended up with 20. We didn't add the sugar and brown sugar to the top of the muffins as we believe muffins should not have sugar on top. We ended up with a semi crunchy outside with semi moist inside. We were also hoping for a richer brown color on the outside. Next time we might lower the temperature and increase the time.

This is a simple but delicious recipe. Very easy to make and turns out well. It reminds me a bit of the bisquick muffins my Aunt used to make when I was a kid. It’s not too cakey like at a bakery. I didn’t change much but I have made them in mini muffin tins and it cuts the baking time down to about 12 minutes. When I bake them in regular size cupcake tins they usually need 17 to 18 minutes depending on how generous you are with the mixture. I also usually add extra chocolate chips to make sure there are enough chips in every bite.
yum!!!
Cooked for 20 minutes and they was burnt id say cook for 15 minutes at 400
The recipe was easy, but the batter was really thick unlike the one showed. Overall good.

Watch the cook time-- Recipe says 20-25 minutes. I fortunately read the reviews and set the timer for 15 minutes. They were done! Next time will check after 13 minutes. I used 1 full cup of regular size chocolate chips as that is what I had on hand. I held back a handful of chips and added on top of the muffins. Also added a bit of coarse sugar on top for gloss and crunch. Looked nice! Don't skimp on the white/brown sugar topping. It is very good! Also added the full cup of milk and 1 t vanilla as others recommended. This is not a super moist muffin, so am glad I added the extra wet ingredients. Make again good, but may further tweak and add more sugar. These are not very sweet "as is".

Something is missing. It tastes like hard nothingness with chocolate chips. Maybe tasteless bread? Idk wished these were better based on the reviews, but on to a different recipe. Ya live and learn through baking though.
I LOVEE this recipe and i am VERRY strict with my muffins, let me talk ya! It was just the right amount of chocolate chips and it was sooo gooey and yummy!!!!
Love them!!!
They tasted good, just not as sweet as i would have liked! They also probably could have had vanilla added in the mix. Over all pretty good!
400 degrees is way to high of a heat to bake muffins. They came out very dry & hard. I couldn’t even eat them.

They are way too dry, and taste like nothing without the chocolate chips. My partner and I picked at one each and will not be finishing the rest. The consistency came out for me like a biscuit, as others have said.
Taste was good but texture a little chewy . Maybe I should have read reviews first.
I made these muffins they were the bom.com I would totally recommend these thanks to allrecipes!❤️💕
went well love this recipe made it many times before
it is amazing taste great
Easy recipe but really disappointing. I found them dry and the sugar top was way too much. I didn't use all of it and still wished I'd used less. Wouldn't make again.
This recipe was great! I put the muffins in the oven for 20 minutes and they were perfectly baked!
I added dairy free milk yummy
I didnt put sugar on the top there currently baking but took 3 mintues to add everything in! i cant add a picture cause i odnt have a camera but its wonderful and fast
So good I made two batches! I followed the recipe exactly apart from substituting oil for melted butter, and they turned out amazing. The crumb topping does make the outside just a bit sticky though.
the author missed so many ingredients in any normal muffin. also the measurements were so off. i was hoping for some muffins to enjoy but i guess not

I had high expectations for this recipe, it looked simple and easy to follow but unfortunately they were not good. The sugar on top created a hard shell that was difficult to bite into and they were dry and overcooked even though I cooked them for the lowest recommended baking time. If your think of making these then some modifications are needed but it would be easier to use a different recipe
It's more like a cookie batter and there is no flavor.
Muffins were hard as a rock. Never making these muffins.
Anyone else get a thicker batter? Mine wasn’t wet, it was more a cookie dough consistency

Came out nice! Followed the recipe to a T, and they taste good. Fluffy and soft interior, crisp but not rock-hard exterior, and an even distribution of chocolate chips throughout the dessert—all great signs of a good muffin to me.
Followed the recipe - baked at 200C foe 20 minutes and they were perfect. Not dry at all.

Recipe was delicious! I used less sugar for the topping, I did 2 teaspoons of granulated sugar, and 1 teaspoon of brown sugar. I also added a little more milk and a tad bit more oil to make sure it was moist. Recipe was great.
These were a huge NOPE they tasted horrible im going to create myown recipe and post it for others to try when I perfect it
Very dry and didn't care for the sugar on top.
I baked it exactly as instructed. They were remarkably good and the texture was just right. Thanks!
Easy and quick and they turn out every time. My family loves them too.
Don’t like this recipe. It’s super dry.
My family thought these were great! The recipe made exactly 12 muffins, my only note would be to leave off the sugar toping if you don't want it too sweet but my teen and hubby loved them as is.
Amazing and fast choclate chip muffins
Turned out amazing love this recipe, easy to make 100% recommend
came out perfect, super easy to make! highly highly recommend adding some vanilla too
These taste too much like bread than muffin. Not the best!
Added 1 tsp vanilla and 1 c Milk
I loved these muffins so easy and don't take too long
This was…………….THE BOMB this has inspired me in baking
It was delicous!!! So good!!
Surprisingly floofy.
They came out perfect!!!!! The sugar in the end really evened it out!!!

Really easy and quick recipe! I did follow the advice of a couple of the other reviewers, and added 1/4 cup of yogurt (would have used sour cream if I had some) in addition to the milk to add moisture. I also added 1 tsp vanilla extract. They are PERFECT. Definitely keeping this recipe handy!
So easy to make!
So yummy! The sugars on top make this muffin even better. Great breakfast food or a snack. They are filling and muy delicioso!

Best muffins ever! I make these so much its insane! Everyone in the family loves them, and they have made me kind of famous! Only change I made is dialing down the cook time. Instead of 20-25 minutes, I had to decrease the time to 15 minutes, otherwise they would get really burned and hard. The fifteen minutes has been perfect every time and these are moist, fluffy, and perfect. Thank you for the amazing recipe!

I would reduce the amount of flour in this recipe. I then had to add more milk and some apple sauce to keep the mixture moist. I even added some vanilla extract. My kids loved the sprinkle of sugar on top. Definitely would try this recipe again. It’s super easy!
Super moist and tasty. I substituted 1/4 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup and brown sugar left everything else the same . These muffins are super easy and quick .
I followed the exact recipe provided and they were awful. Bland, dry, so disappointing. When I reread the reviews I saw many people modified the recipe and I wish I had done that.
